name: Blessed Virgin Mary

locations.description: Present at the Crucifixion and Pentecost
According to tradition, lived in Ephesus with John

summary: Mary, the Mother of Jesus Christ, is venerated as the Theotokos (God-bearer) and holds a unique place in Christian tradition. She was present at key moments in Jesus' life, including the Crucifixion, and was among the disciples gathered at Pentecost. According to Catholic and Orthodox tradition, she was assumed body and soul into heaven. She is the most prominent saint in Christian devotion and the patroness of countless churches, cities, and causes.
keyQuotes: Behold, I am the handmaid of the Lord. May it be done to me according to your word.
My soul magnifies the Lord, and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior.
